task_summary: Perceive, align to, and push the blue Pepsi can along the tabletop without grasping, then retreat to a safe pose.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm on a white semicircular table must push a blue Pepsi can to a new location. Other distractor objects are present: a red soda can, a red rectangular block, an orange cuboid, a clear plastic cup, and a green bottle. The robot should first locate the Pepsi can, approach and align the tool center point, ensure the gripper is open, then execute a controlled push in the intended lateral direction. The push should translate the can without tipping or colliding with neighboring items, followed by a brief retreat and pause.
preconditions: Pepsi can visible on table and reachable
Workspace free along intended push path
Gripper open; no object in gripper
Robot is in nominal operation state
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the Pepsi can.
Move above the can and refine alignment.
Ensure gripper is open for non-grasp contact.
Push the can laterally along the table surface.
Retreat to clear the object and wait briefly.
success_criteria: Blue Pepsi can translates approximately 0.20 m along the table in the commanded direction
No tipping or loss of stability of the can
Robot returns to a safe clearance after pushing
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: rescan with the scanning action and reattempt detection.
If alignment is off: repeat ApproachAndAlign before pushing.
If contact slips or the can tips: retreat, re-approach, and execute a shorter push.
If the path is blocked: retreat and select a shorter distance or different direction.
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends after the push completes successfully and the robot retreats and waits.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Scan the scene in a line pattern to localize the Pepsi can.
Confirm perception and pose of the Pepsi can.
Move to a pose directly above the can with a small vertical offset.
Laterally approach and align TCP with the push direction near the can.
Ensure gripper is open for non-grasp pushing contact.
Execute a planar push of the can to the screen-right direction.
Back off to clear the object after pushing.
Brief pause to allow dynamics to settle.

recovery_strategy: Alter push direction to avoid obstacles
assumptions: The 'pepsi can' refers to the blue can seen near table center-right.
Push direction is estimated as screen-right (direction_deg=90) based on object layout; world frame mapping may differ.
No grasp is required; task is pure pushing contact.

expected_success_criteria: Pepsi can displacement ≥ 0.15–0.20 m towards the right without tipping
Robot ends in a safe clearance pose
